attributes.comment:
As a parent waiting for referral from China for my third child, I am concerned about
the possibitlity of increasing charges to renew my I-600A and my I-171H USCIS
forms. Through no fault of our own, the process for our adoption has stretched
from the predicted 8-10 month wait to at least a 20 month wait. During this time,
our paperwork will have surpased its 18 month time limit and we will need to
resubmit all applications in order to bring our child home.
There have been many requests and opportunities for the government to extend
the exipiration of our documents, yet that option has not been pursued. Now to
increase the cost to renew forms that we are required to submit is adding insult to
injury. This process is costly enough without the added pressure of form renewal,
and all of the associated charges that will go with that.
Please reconsider increasing the fees and think of the citizens who you are
supposed to be serving. To avoid the "need" for higher fee schedules, simply
extend the time limit that our original paperwork is valid. Less work for the USCIS
employees, less cost for the government, less cost to your citizens who have
already jumped through all of the necessary hoops once, and are about to get
nailed in our wallets because we have to do it again.
Thank you,
Amelia Mowery
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Amelia G. Mowery
